alert.note: Alert for Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 4:51PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Yellowstone County through 515 PM MDT... At 450 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Huntley, or 12 miles east of Billings, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail with heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Yellowstone County. This advisory does not include the city of Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Motorists on I-90 should prepare for rapidly changing conditions. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
